metadata.title: CVE-2023-28772 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - negligible
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel before 5.13.3. lib/seq_buf.chas a seq_buf_putmem_hex buffer overflow.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-28772` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1123-azure - 4.15.0-1123.136~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-lts-xenial: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-aws: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1123.136~14.04.1').
